CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Lawton, 771 Bryn Mawr Road, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?" answer reads: "I think that Negro leadership is gradually becoming an effective force, but it can be improved quite a bit.  For one thing, we should have more than just one colored judge.  Also, I think that we should have more colored representation in the Legislature from this area.  That is, more qualified colored similar to Atty. K. Leroy Irvis, whom I think will be elected soon and who is a good leader."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Lawton wearing light colored fedora with dark band, moustache, and dark suit jacket, standing in front of Rosenbaum Company, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
